column3: Better to return outside the switch, I think, so the full coverage of the switch is still checked via `-Wswitch`. In that case could `assert` at the end instead, to show that it's never hit.
@Empact That's a good point! Adjusted accordingly (but without `assert`). Please re-review :-)

> Better to return outside the switch, I think, so the full coverage of the switch is still checked via -Wswitch. In that case could assert at the end instead, to show that it's never hit.\n\nThe switch statement covers all possible options, I think it's strange to return a value that can never be returned, if an "unknown" value ends up it can only be due to memory corruption either a software o
Generally I agree, but the only callers for this are to output directly to the user in `analyzepsbt`, so the options are: display "unknown" amongst other data, or fail out.
@laanwj Thanks for reviewing. Now asserting. Please re-review :-)
